Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends Object
Represents the game board logic for a Tetris-like game. Manages the grid, detects collisions, merges bricks, and clears completed rows.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameBoard(int width, int height)
    Constructs a new GameBoard with the specified width and height.

    Methods inherited from class Object

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard(int width, int height)
      Constructs a new GameBoard with the specified width and height. Initializes an empty game matrix.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the game board.
      height - The height of the game board.

  • Method Details

    • getGameMatrix

      public int[][] getGameMatrix()
      Returns a copy of the current 2D integer array representing the game board's state. Each integer in the matrix represents a block type or an empty space.
      Returns:
      A deep copy of the game matrix.

    • isCollision

      public boolean isCollision(Point offset, int[][] shape)
      Checks if a given brick shape, placed at a specific offset, would collide with existing blocks on the game board or go out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      offset - The (x, y) coordinates for the top-left corner of the brick.
      shape - The 2D integer array representing the brick's shape.
      Returns:
      True if a collision is detected, false otherwise.

    • mergeBrick

      public void mergeBrick(Point offset, int[][] shape)
      Merges a given brick shape into the game board's matrix at the specified offset. This operation modifies the game board permanently.
      Parameters:
      offset - The (x, y) coordinates for the top-left corner where the brick will be merged.
      shape - The 2D integer array representing the brick's shape to merge.

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()
      Checks the game board for any completed rows, removes them, and shifts the remaining blocks down.
      Returns:
      A ClearRow object containing information about the cleared rows and the new state of the game board.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the game board to an empty state. All cells in the game matrix will be reinitialized to zero.

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the game board.
      Returns:
      The height of the game board in number of rows.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the game board.
      Returns:
      The width of the game board in number of columns.
